0.cdata!:
Ecuador - Proyecto de Asistencia Tecnica
            para Desarrollo Minero y Control Ambiental : Informe y
            recomendacion de la administracion en repuesta al informe de
            investigacion del Grupo de Inspeccion

abstracts.cdata!:
This report constitutes the management
            response to the Inspection Panel ' s investigation
            report upon the Ecuador Mining Development and Environment
            Control Technical Assistance Project. The management concurs
            with the assessments of the Inspection Panel of the actions
            of the bank and accepts the position that a more expanded
            and robust Environmental Assessment and consultation process
            should have been undertaken. The management is not proposing
            any remedial efforts with regard to the claims made by the
            Requesters and notes the Inspection Panel indication that
            material adverse effects to the Requestors may be considered
            as remote. Bank staff will continue to work to implement
            actions agreed on under the Project with the following
            precautions: a) the participation of Nongovernmental
            organizations in monitoring the use and application of the
            information generated under the Project; b) enforcement of
            the standard license agreements for the use of the
            information; and c) further publication of brochures, and
            workshops on the use of geo-information. The development of
            consultation mechanisms for mining activities in Ecuador has
            been initiated and is linked to that of other extractive
            industries. There will be continuing support for
            conservation and environmental management in Ecuador
            including the strengthening of environmental institutions.
